meanings.definition: Give (someone) the authority or power to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher impowered the students to choose their own project topics.
meanings.sent2: The manager impowered her team to make decisions independently.
meanings.sent3: The magician impowered the rabbit to perform tricks on its own.
meanings.sent4: The superhero impowered the citizens with the ability to fly.
meanings.sent5: The fairy godmother impowered Cinderella with a magical dress and glass slippers.

meanings.sent1: The new technology impowered people to communicate instantly across the globe.
meanings.sent2: Education impowers individuals to pursue their dreams and goals.
meanings.sent3: The special potion impowered the cat to speak human language.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to impower emotions and memories.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact impowered the archaeologist to unlock hidden secrets of the past.

meanings.sent1: The king impowered his loyal knight with the title of Sir.
meanings.sent2: The president impowered the committee to make important decisions on his behalf.
meanings.sent3: The wizard impowered the apprentice with the ability to cast spells.
meanings.sent4: The mentor impowered the student with knowledge and confidence.
meanings.sent5: The tribal chief impowered the young warrior with the responsibility of leading the tribe.
